summary: This document is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) contractor and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the technical processing and review of files for an NTW (Non-Trial Witness) production, specifically referencing 'Epstein Emails from VSD' and other folders. It concerns the conversion of email files to PDF format for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The AUSA is reviewing the NTW production 5 folder, requests PDF conversion of emails, and inquires about an empty folder.

connections.description: Contractor (M) is communicating with and taking technical direction from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the preparation of document productions related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Email exchange regarding NTW 5 production processing
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney and a contractor exchange emails about converting emails (including from 'Epstein Emails from VSD') to PDF and managing folders for an NTW production.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email chain is related to the processing of document productions, specifically 'NTW 5', in the Epstein case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
One of the folders being processed is explicitly named 'Epstein Emails from VSD', indicating the content involves emails related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence highlights the procedural, technical steps (converting emails to PDF) involved in preparing materials for legal review and production in the investigation.
